str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Witness, evidence, testimony, reputation. From martus; evidence given.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Witness, evidence, testimony, reputation. From martus; evidence given.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
This; he, she, it.

str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
